resources.string: If a key is set in the song and in the abc notation, the app will try to adjust the output of the abc notation to match the song key.
App info, help, user guide, etc.

Click to show or hide your page buttons.

Each one can be assigned to song actions such as metronome, transpose, pads, etc.
Long pressing on the main button lets you change the settings of each button.
Long pressing on some page buttons performs quick actions such as start/stop/edit
Change the appearance of the information in the actionbar
has been added to the end of your current set.
This restricts the number of folders to 128 in total. The first 111 are designated as folders and the remaining 17 are designated as playlists
When using a pedal that does not send long press actions, you can simulate this by setting a desired long press time
Clicking on an item in the alphabetical index will toggle between one and two character alphabetical index
Autohide the main page button when not expanded
The app will make the text as large as possible to fit the screen
Keep autoscroll activated when changing songs
If you haven\'t set a song duration should the default values be used or do you want to be asked each time?
Use duration of link audio file
Create a backup of OpenSongApp songs (*.osb)
Compares your song \'Filename\', \'Title\' and \'Also known as\' fields with your BeatBuddy database. If a matching song is found, the folder and song code are sent over MIDI automatically
Browse the songs on the BeatBuddy (using the default project or imported project)
Clear the BeatBuddy database in the app. This will restore the pedal defaults only.
Dynamic MIDI messages (the app deals with the code)
Folder must be a number between 1 and 16384
There was a problem importing the BeatBuddy project. Please refer to the user manual for more information.
You have two options of importing project information from your BeatBuddy:
1. Connect the BeatBuddy or BeatBuddy SD card to this device using a USB cable and select the root/main folder
2. Import a combined MyBeatBuddyProject.csv file created on your computer using my BeatBuddy python script (available from the downloads page). You can import the .csv file directly
Select the desired option below to begin the import process.
This will allow you to select/browse drumkits, songs and folders by name from your BeatBuddy pedal
Edit and save song commands for use with a BeatBuddy pedal
Automatically match your OpenSongApp songs to those on your BeatBuddy pedal
Use existing MyBeatBuddyProject.csv file (found in OpenSong/Settings)
Song must be a number between 1 and 128

Tap an item to prepare and send the MIDI code. Alternatively, long press to save the name of this BeatBuddy item to your song (used when automatically sending BeatBuddy song). This method always matches the song name regardless of which folder or song number it is
Download a bible translation for offline use
Bible translation not available above? Try manually downloading another language/translation from one of the two sites listed below.
You should extract the zip file into your OpenSong/OpenSong Scripture/ folder. The file extracted should be an xml or xmm file.
Fade in/out song content over the background
Apply a background shadow to the lyrics to improve readability
Display chords and headings in bold
Take a photograph of a songsheet

OpenSongApp using screen mirroring to display on a second screen. If the app is unable open your cast settings page showing available devices, you will have to manually start screen mirroring on your device before running OpenSongApp. The app will then use the connected screen
Export your CCLI log as a XML file
Open your current CCLI log for viewing
Click on a background to use it. Long press / right click to change it.
Choose folder to save file in
If a song has capo chords, which chords should be shown?
C C#/Db D D#/Eb E F F#/Gb G G#/Ab A A#/Bb B
C C#/Db D D#/Eb E F F#/Gb G G#/Ab A A#/B H
C Cis/Des D Dis/Es E F Fis/Ges G Gis/As A Ais/B H
DO DO#/REb RE RE#/MIb MI FA FA#/SOLb SOL SOL#/LAb LA LA#/SIb SI
I II III IV V VI VII VIII IX X XI XII
C Cis/Des D Dis/Es E F Fis/Ges G Gis/As A Ais/Bes B
If a song uses a different chord format, should the app try to display using preferred setting
Always assume original songs are in my preferred chord format
Default for transposing and capo display
Assume current/detected and desired chord format is
Uses chord extraction code from Chordinator Augmented from Paul Evans. Used by permission
This method will attempt to find chord sheets automatically, but it is unsuccessful, you can manually extract content using the select and copy method described below
All chords found in the song lyrics
When you find the song lyrics/chords you want to import, highlight them and click on the \'Copy\' option in the clipboard.
Use the new page code (!--) in the song to force a new column break when autoscaling
Listen for autoscroll stop and start commands
Rather than try to load matching OpenSong files, try to load PDF files with the same name (but ending with .pdf)
Listen for scroll up and down commands
Confirm the code matches on both devices:
Listen for instructions from connected devices that are set as hosts
Control other connected devices that are set as clients
Show more settings for Nearby connections and full log
Advertise your device for others to discover
Only advertise for 10 seconds after clicking the advertise button
Once you have made a connection, you can change between host and client as required
Shows a list of currently connected devices
Connect to other devices running OpenSongApp
Look for other devices that are currently advertising
Allow messages received from other hosts to pass through to connected clients
If you do not already have the host song in your library, the app will copy if for you
Connection log (click to clear). If you have any issues, reset your Wi-Fi and restart the app.

If you have issues connecting devices, try changing the connection mode. Cluster mode (default) is the most versatile and allows multiple devices to connect to each other allowing switching between host and clients. Star mode only allows one device to connect to many. Single mode is to establish a connection between only two devices, but with the best bandwith. All connecting devices need to be set to the same mode and changing mode will end all current connections.
Close any connections and stop advertising and discovering
View the host version of the song instead of your own
Take the chords from one section and apply them to another
Use the chord structure in this section
There was an error creating the new folder!
Treat text inside curly brackets as performance notes only. These will be hidden during presentation.
Hide curly bracket text on this device (and connected displays when in Performance mode)
A custom chord with this name already exists for this instrument
Custom chords saved with the current song
Double taps and long presses on the song window

If you delete this subdirectory, this will also delete any songs or folders that it contains. You cannot undo this change!\n\nPlease make sure you have made and saved backups of ALL your files before proceeding!!!
You cannot undo this action. Please make sure you have created a backup just in case!
Change display settings (what you see on screen)
You have used the same tag multiple times in the song. This can cause problems when setting the order.
Create a copy of this song
Change item or key or make a variation
You are editing a song that is a set variation item. Any changes are saved to the variation in the set only.
This item is transposed in the set. You have been taken to the original song for editing.
There was an error saving the song
You have already used the following install locations. You will still need to locate and set this manually using the red button above.
Are you sure you want to exit the program?
OpenSong formatted songs can also be converted to the following formats
Include songs identified in the set
File already exists. Please rename it.
Keep a log of file activities (creation, saving, editing, etc.). Can help identify issues if something goes wrong.
Keep a log of the most recently viewed songs
This button is used to include an artist filter for your song list
Refine your search by choosing an option from the drop down list here
Refine your search by entering some text here
This button is used to include a folder filter for your song list. Turn it off to remove the filter.
This button is used to include a key filter for your song list
This button is used to include a tag/theme filter for your song list
Further filter by this value. This filter searches titles, filenames, user fields and hymn numbers
Add each filter on a new line below.
You can filter sections by using prefixes. If you add the filter \'guitar\', any sections using this prefix would be filtered. e.g. [*guitar:Instrumental]
By default filtered sections are hidden, but you can set this to only show these filtered sections instead
Filter the list of songs shown
Find previous installation locations for OpenSong files
Either this is your first time running the app, or something has changed. Due to Android permissions, we need you to set your desired storage location for the app to store its files.
Try to fix minor formatting issues
Choose a font from the list below
Display presented lyrics using bold text
Report bugs, get help and request features
This allows you to browse songs quickly and only sends information to other connected devices after a grace time period of 2s.
Turning on hardware acceleration can make scrolling smoother, however, it can cause display bugs and crashes on certain devices.
Drag the toolbox around using this button
This shows your current highlighter tool. Click on it to change the tool or its settings

Your device was unable to create a screenshot of the song for previewing with the highlighter as it was too large. Please try changing the autoscaling of the song to full or reducing the maximum font scaling size.
Top and bottom center hot zones will be disabled
Top left hot zone will be disabled
Other areas of the screen are reserved for page buttons, song information and are not available. Hot zones will block other actions in these areas
Assign custom actions to areas of the screen

If your device has notches (display cutouts), you can force the app to still draw over this space. Make sure you can still see the menu buttons before you leave this page, otherwise you might not be able to access the app settings!
Rounded screen corner can cause text to be clipped. Ignoring rounded corners will ask the app to use the full screen width/height (recommended). You can always adjust the margins below.
Click on the image to change
Hide navigation and status bars to use more of your display
Restore songs from OpenSongApp backup file (*.osb)
There was an error building the song index
Index every song in your OpenSong/Songs folder

Indexing songs is required if you have edited, created or deleted songs outwith OpenSongApp (including synchronising devices) or if this is a new installation. You can skip this if nothing has changed and speed up the boot process.
Only index songs that have changed since the index was last built
Please wait until song indexing is completed
Hide once the information has been displayed and a minimum time has elapsed
MIDI commands that can be triggered by clicking on a song section
Most PDF documents have a light background and dark text. Inverting the colours will make this have a dark background and light text similar to a dark or night theme.
Display songs containing combined verses as they appear in the song edit window.
Transpose the song back to the original key
Try to trim the top and bottom of a line to get rid of font padding. Can help maximise text size.
Set this as the song pad/backing track
Choose a file to link with this song
The link is not valid, please reset the link.
Link files, audio, etc. to songs
Select a document on your device. If you want to allow synchronising across devices, this file should be saved somewhere inside your OpenSong folder.
Search for this song on the internet. If you find a suitable web page, copy the web address to the clipboard, then return here and paste it into the box above.
Try to find this song on YouTube. If you find the correct item, select the \'Share\' option and then copy the link to the clipboard. You can then return here and paste the link above.
To connect to devices please turn \'Location\' ON. If you have a choice of mode, choose a mode that uses Wi-Fi.
Manage file logs (can help with debugging)
Toggle between the logo and the song content
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
Reduces the height reserved for the navigation bar
Adjust the margins around the content to avoid screen cutouts and rounded corners
Leave space for detected device controls (bottom navigation bar and side menus)
If a song is shown in multiple columns (e.g. when rotated to landscape), this allows each column to zoom to fill the portion of the screen it is allocated.
Use this button to view and manage your sets
Change settings for the song/set menu
Open the menu to view and manage your songs and sets
Use this button view and manage your songs
How should songs be listed in the menu?
Keep metronome running when changing songs
Choose which MIDI action should be assigned this code
Edit custom MIDI commands that can be assigned to actions (e.g. foot pedals, page buttons, hot zones)
Click on buttons to send MIDI. Long press on buttons to edit them.
Use a collection of MIDI commands and sliders to control connected devices
Some devices rely on receiving multiple controller messages quickly. When switched on, any MIDI command generated will be annotated by * as a burst command (i.e. sent several times in a row)
MIDI code currently assigned to action
View and edit MIDI commands that are sent to connected devices when the song loads
Connect midi devices and change settings
Click to test, swipe to delete, or rearrange
Include this in the song messages
Static MIDI messages (messages saved with the song)
Only listen for new clients when this page is visible
Connection requests will not be shown unless you are on this page
This large song file is being shared
Send the matching alert message to connected devices
The messages can be assigned to action controls (e.g. page buttons) but also added to custom MIDI actions so connected devices are notified of a MIDI action being sent
Show any text messages received from Nearby host as a sticky note. If switched off, messages are displayed as alert boxes that display for a few seconds
Add subfolders in your Songs folder
No application is available or installed that can open this item.
This function is not allowed for this item
Please enter a filename for your song
Please select a folder for your song
Choose a folder to save imported songs
The recommended option is to import into a separate OnSong folder. You can always move songs into other folders later.
Override full autoscale to width only

If the autoscale font size is less than the desired minimum font size, do you want the app to override to a different scaling method? Using these options may force you to scroll horizontally and vertically in a song
Override width only scaling to no autoscale
This will automatically start pads when moving between songs and allow a smooth cross fade. You must manually start the pad the first time.

Set custom pads to use as backing tracks matching song keys. These files must be saved in the OpenSong/Pads folder. Songs that have the pad set as \'Auto\' and have a key set will use the file noted here.
There is a problem with the custom auto pad set for this key
Choose built in or custom pads to match each key
There is a problem with the link audio file
Control or edit the current pad or backing track
The key of this song has not been set
Pads are switched off for this song
Use a pad with this song
Pad progress is shown here. Tap to pause, press and hold to stop.
Send me a donation if you find the app useful
When autoscale is set to full and the device is in landscape orientation PDF pages will be shown side by side (scaled by height)
Previewing PDF files directly is not supported on many mobile web browsers, but you can open the file using the button below.
Show a warning before moving to the next song
Set up foot pedal buttons and actions
Click on a pedal button below to assign it to a keyboard button or midi note and assign actions to it. Most Bluetooth pedals send keyboard commands (e.g. arrow up/down).
To use a midi pedal, make sure you have connected it using the midi settings in the app first.
Try to scroll before changing songs
Allows next/previous pedals to also function as scroll pedals

Test a connected pedal by pressing the button on your pedal. The code being sent will be displayed. Long press a button on the pedals to allow the app to try and identify the recommended long press mode to use (if available).
Confirm song change by pressing the pedal again after this warning closes
Use your device as a songbook
Permissions were refused and may need to be granted manually from Android settings if you do not see the option again
This stores extra information (key, notes, autoscroll, midi, etc.) for non OpenSong songs such as PDF files
Allow zooming in and out of a song in Performance mode using the pinch to zoom gesture
To use Google Cast, Fonts and Nearby Connections, you will need to install Google Play Services.
Use large popups for drop-down menus
Choose your preferred key settings for transposing and capo display
Control the display to a projector
The song presentation order is shown below. You can drag items to rearrange the order and swipe to remove.
If presentation order exists for the song, use this to create the display
Profiles are used to store your display preferences.
The following profiles have been found in the OpenSong/Profiles folder. Click on an item to select it.
Click here to reset any connected displays

You haven\'t backed up your song library in the last 10 times you have used this app. This is highly recommended as you can recover your songs if anything goes wrong. Ideally you should keep a copy of your backup file on the cloud (e.g. Google Drive) or email it to yourself.
Select a random song from those currently shown in the menu
Rename or change the category of a saved set
Number of key up commands to qualify as a long press (in the time stated above)
For pedals that send repeated key down and up commands this can simulate a long press action
Time to listen for repeated key down and key up commands
If you are having difficulties with the app, try clearing your preferences. This will not delete your songs.
Please restart the app to apply the changes
When switched on, the app zooms the text to fill the width of the screen. You might have to scroll down to see the rest of the song. When off, the app fits the entire song into the window.
Show each section of a song with a box around it (as in stage mode)
This section does not exist in the song. Please remove this item, or create the section in the lyrics tab.
This section is in the song, but is not in the Presentation order.
Add a small space between sections to improve visibility
Drag songs around to change the order of your set
Show the setlist on the screen beside the song window
This is the inline set which allows a view of the setlist while you are performing. You can change the settings in Settings / Display / Inline set.
There are no items in your set
You can change the folder/filename of the song loaded from the set and you can also change the key for song display (this performs a temporary transpose of the song on your device if required)
Open the loaded set at the first item
Always open the first set item. If switched off, the set will attempt to open at the currently loaded song if it is in the set.
Choosing more than one will merge them in the order selected.
Click on an item in the set to view it
Save, load, export, remove, import and backup sets
Swipe to remove an item from your set list
Remove all songs from the current set
Save the current set for future use
Select a saved set. Current sets should be saved before exporting.
Share or export a set with others
Randomise the order of songs in the set
Display chords found in the song
Display lyrics found in the song
Also show previous/next for songs not in a set (using song menu)
Insert new page to custom slide
Reduce the size of the page buttons on screen
That song isn\'t on your device. Have you deleted it?
These values are best set using the dedicated song feature options in the settings menu. Save the song first. You can, however, manually edit the values here.
Show set checkboxes in song menu
Unfortunately this song title / filename has already been used (a suggestion could be to add a version number to the end).
Enter a new file name for this song (this is how it will appear in your song menu)
The sections found in your song lyrics are shown below. Click on the buttons to add them to the presentation order.
Click on a song section to send it to the connected displays
Displays a title with information about the song
Display songs split into sections or as a stage monitor

Your current OpenSong/Songs folder directory structure is shown below.
Click on the OpenSong (ROOT) folder to change your storage location.
Click on the Songs (MAIN) folder to create a backup or a sub directory.
If you already have sub directories, clicking on them will give further options.

Please select your \'OpenSong\' folder. This where songs, sets and more are stored. If you need a new folder simply select a location for one to be added. You can change this at any time from the Options menu. Internal storage is recommended.\nFor an update or re-install: You can use the yellow button (not available in Android 11+) to find any previous \'OpenSong\' folder.
This is where your songs are normally stored (often called the MAIN folder). You can optionally set up subdirectories to better manage your song library.

When selecting an OpenSong folder location:
SELECT ONLY INTERNAL OR SD CARD storage.
Internal storage is recommended. This may list as device storage or with your device's name.
When selecting you may need to change settings to show all storage.
On Android 10+ you should not select the Downloads or Root folder. If in doubt, choose the 'Documents' folder.
Click here to change your storage location (where the root OpenSong folder is located).
Manage your storage location and song folders
"Please do not select the \'Songs\' folder as your storage location. You should select the parent \'OpenSong\' folder location instead."
Adjust gestures to move between songs
Highlighted songs contain the chosen tag. Click on any song to add/remove the chosen tag.
Click here to create a new tag that you can add to songs
Click here to show only songs that already have this tag
Manage song tags to help with song searching
The tag to add or remove from songs
This theme tag will be removed from the following songs:

When exporting multiple files to some apps (e.g. WhatsApp) the app sometimes stops after it receives a text message and the files aren\'t included. You can switch this off and force the receiving app to deal with the files instead of just the message.
Include song details. Devices with smaller displays may not show the content properly
OpenSongApp will try to find song content automatically, however, you can manually check by clicking on this button.
Song text found on this page. Click here to extract.
Keep the chords the same, but change the position of the capo
Make a copy of this song and transpose it, leaving the original unchanged.
Change the chords in the current song
When viewing this song in the current set, it will temporarily be transposed. The original song will be unchanged.
Gets rid of blank lines after each section to maximise text size

"[Intro] Welcome to OpenSongApp! This page shows you some of the features of the app. OpenSongApp has three operating modes: • Performance Mode – behave like a traditional song book • Stage Mode – control stage display monitors/projector • Presenter Mode – full control of a projector
[Menus] Song and set menus are accessed using the hamburger icon The settings menus allow you to access all the app settings
[Get help] Click on the ? icon in the app or visit the online manual: https://www.opensongapp.com
[Adding songs] You can manually create any song you like. The app does not come with any songs due to copyright. You can start a song by import from other services: • Desktop OpenSong – I recommend syncing using Dropbox • ChordPro files • Online sources (Ultimate Guitar, Chordie, SongSelect, etc) • some iOS app song files Use the + button in the songs menu to see your options
Songs are stored in OpenSong format (xml files) These are stored in the /OpenSong/Songs folder.
[Edit the song] By default, double tap on the screen to edit a song. Alternatively, click on the song title.
[Chords at work] This song has been set as having a key of G. .G D Em C G G7 Chord lines (above) start with a full stop/period (.) You can set capo display and transpose the chords easily, Multiple chord formats are understood.
[Scaling] By default OpenSongApp scales to song width. Change this using Settings > Display > Scaling setting
;HERE IS AN EXAMPLE OF A SONG
[Intro] .||: G | D/F# | Em7 | D :|| [V1] .G2 D/F# Love everlasting, love without measure .Em7 D Full of compassion, righteous and pure .C G/B Am7 C/D D Is my Saviour\'s love, is my Father\'s heart [V2] .G2 D/F# Loved by the Father, saved by the Son .Em7 D Born of His Spirit, washed in the blood .C G/B Am7 C/D D This is my Saviour\'s love, this is my Father\'s heart
[B] .Em Cmaj7 Em Cmaj7 Your love for me, ___it reaches to the heavens .Em Cmaj7 Bm7 Let my love for You __just grow and grow! .Em Cmaj7 Em Cmaj7 Your love for me, ___it reaches to the heavens .Em Cmaj7 D D/F# Let my love for You __just grow and grow! [V3] .G2 D/F# Love sent from heaven, received in our hearts .Em7 D Loving each other, since Christ first loved us .C G/B Am7 C/D D Sharing my Saviour\'s love, showing my Father\'s heart
[Outro] ;(Slow to end) .| G |"
Make a copy of this song that can be edited. This song can be saved into a set and loaded back, but is lost when clearing the set
Allow users without OpenSongApp to view your songs using a web browser
Non OpenSongApp users should be on the same network as this device (you can also use a hotspot). They should then open this web address to view the song.
When switched on, users can manually choose any song shown in your song list or current set. When switched off, users can only view your currently loaded song
This should improve the layout of songs and avoid the website trying to force you to install their mobile app
